titleStmt.title: 2nd United States Tax District of Kentucky

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: 2nd United States Tax District of Kentucky

body.p: Created by the Revenue Act of 1862. Comprised of the following counties (1862-1863): Green, Taylor, Adair, Cumberland, Clinton, Russell, Casey, Boyle, Garrard, Lincoln, Rockcastle, Pulaski, Wayne, Whitley, Laurel, Jackson, Madison, Estill, Owsley, Clay, Knox, Harlan, Perry, Breathitt, Magoffin, Johnson, Floyd, Pike, and Letcher.

Following the redistricting of the district in 1864, the following counties comprised the 2nd U.S. Tax District of Kentucky (1864-1865): Todd, Logan, Simpson, Warren, Allen, Monroe, Cumberland, Clinton, Russell, Adair, Metcalfe, Barren, Hart, Green, Taylor, Marion, LaRue, Hardin, Meade, Bullitt, Nelson, Washington, Anderson, Spencer, and Shelby.

bibl.p: See U.S. Tax District maps; Income Taxes 1862-1962: A History of the Internal Revenue Service (Washington: U.S. Government Printing Office, 1963).
